header.title: The Scroll of Set
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Setianism, Modern Magic

central_thesis: The combined articles present a multifaceted exploration of Setian philosophy and practical magic, positing that reality encompasses a 'fifth dimension' of probability from which individuals choose their 'lives' through expanded consciousness. Setians engage in self-creation (Xeper) by utilizing Lesser Magic to manipulate existing systems for personal advancement and undergo a structured initiatory process, metaphorically akin to programming, leading to the reception of the 'Black Flame' and the potential to influence the æon.

structure_content.summary: Proposes a 'fifth dimension' as 'probability,' an infinite field of universes where all possible decisions exist. Deja vu is explained as the conscious mind briefly accessing this dimension. The core idea is that 'higher selves' choose which 'life' to focus on, implying individual control over destiny and the potential to expand consciousness across this fifth dimension.

Contrasts Setians with conventional rebels, highlighting that Setians utilize 'Lesser Magic' to operate within and benefit from existing social structures while retaining an external, independent stance. This approach allows them to gain advantage and profit without conforming.

Advocates for integrating modern technology, specifically personal stereos (Walkmans) and music, into Setian rituals. It suggests that using personal stereos provides an intimate, effective, and motivating ritual environment, framing this as a practical application of Lesser Magic for enhancing magical workings.

Explores the Setian concept of 'essence,' distinguishing it from the 'soul' (which is seen as a temporary 'battery' for the body). Essence is linked to consciousness, permanence, and the potential for 'true immortality' for Setians, especially in relation to the 'Black Flame' and ceremonial magic.

Employs an extended analogy between programming EPROM chips for computer cartridges and the Setian initiatory path. It details stages from initial 'erasure' (purification of 'garbage') for new initiates (I°) to receiving the 'Black Flame' (II° Adept) which permanently programs one's life. Further stages (Magi V°/VI°) involve 'uttering a new Word' and influencing the æon, representing advanced self-creation (Xeper).

key_concepts.definition: An infinite field of universes where all possible existence and decisions are made; individual 'higher selves' choose which 'life' or reality to focus their energies on.
The conscious mind's brief access or 'vision' into the fifth dimension, perceiving a nearly identical alternate reality.
An individual who, through Lesser Magic, adeptly navigates and benefits from existing social structures without conforming to them, seeking personal advantage and profit for self-creation.
The practice of using the existing social or physical system to one's advantage and profit, while maintaining an external and independent stance.

The individual's real, ultimate, and permanent nature, distinct from the temporary 'soul.' It is connected to consciousness, provides a place for permanence, and is central to achieving 'true immortality' for Setians, particularly in relation to the Black Flame.

A transformative, energetic principle received by an Adept (II°) during Setian initiation. It is described as permanently programming one's life and magic, causing a palpable internal change ('feeling warm, seeing lights, an 'electricity'').
The Setian path of self-creation, becoming, and individual evolution; implicitly the goal of the initiatory process.

A profound expression or manifestation of understanding and will, 'uttered' by advanced Setians (Magi V°/VI°), capable of changing the outcome of the æon and ensuring the survival of the Elect and Set.

A structured path of self-transformation, likened to programming an EPROM chip. Stages include 'erasing garbage' (purification), receiving the 'Black Flame' (permanent programming), and eventually 'plugging in' to display one's 'memory' on the 'magical screen of the æon' (Magi V°) or having the 'Word' fixed in memory (VI°).

practical_system.description: The system outlined encourages individual self-deification through the philosophy of Xeper, involving a continuous process of self-transformation and the conscious manipulation of reality. This is achieved through an expanded awareness of a 'fifth dimension' (probability), the strategic application of Lesser Magic to influence mundane circumstances, and a structured initiatory path. This path, metaphorically detailed as EPROM programming, involves purifying the self ('erasing garbage'), receiving a transformative 'Black Flame,' and ultimately 'uttering a new Word' to exert influence on the collective consciousness or 'æon.'
rituals: Greater Magical working with a specific goal in mind
Portable Rituals (using personal stereos and music)

relevant_quotes.text: What if all that could exist did? If all decisions were made in every possible way, and that which we ignorantly assert as factual were but one combination, one universe in an infinite field of universes? Just as 'now' is a frozen cross-section of our lives, our lives are but a thin cross-section of probability.
In the use of Lesser Magic the Setian is able to use and operate within the given system - to use it to his advantage and still stand outside of it.
Ouspensky also considered the consciousness of a person to lie in that person's essence, and essence provided a place for permanence of 'things'.
The first step we went through was to have the garbage we'd collected in our lives erased by our will in accordance with the will of Set. We are being prepared as new initiates for what will follow.

One can sense the change in our lives when our Flame is turned on. Its almost like feeling warm, seeing lights; and there's an 'electricity' which cannot be missed. Our lives and magic are permanently programmed with and by this Flame. Nothing except an outside influence can ever change us.
If Set 'plugs us in', our memory is displayed on the magical screen of the æon for all to see and for some to Understand. Should this occur, we are Magi V°.

critical_analysis.relevance: This collection of articles offers a detailed glimpse into the esoteric philosophy and practical applications within the Temple of Set during a specific period (1984). It expands upon core Setian concepts like Xeper by introducing novel ideas such as the 'fifth dimension of probability' and offering a techno-magical analogy for initiation, making complex spiritual processes relatable through contemporary technology (EPROM programming). The emphasis on Lesser Magic as a strategic tool for personal advancement within conventional society underscores the practical, results-oriented nature of Setianism. The nuanced discussion of 'essence' clarifies a fundamental aspect of Setian metaphysics concerning identity, consciousness, and immortality.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The content is primarily aimed at existing initiates and practitioners within the Temple of Set, providing theoretical depth and practical considerations for their ongoing Xeper. It also serves as a valuable resource for academic researchers, occultists from other traditions, and independent practitioners interested in understanding the specific cosmology, philosophical underpinnings, and operative magical techniques of a prominent modern initiatory current.
